thread.title: Obama taps Clinton to lead delegation to Bosnian genocide memorial
thread.title_full: Obama taps Clinton to lead delegation to Bosnian genocide memorial

author: Jordan Fabian
title: Obama taps Clinton to lead delegation to Bosnian genocide memorial
text: Obama taps Clinton to lead delegation to Bosnian genocide memorial By Jordan Fabian - 07/08/15 06:35 PM EDT President Obama has selected Bill Clinton to lead the presidential delegation to Bosnia and Herzegovina for a commemoration of the Srebrenica genocide in Bosnia. The remembrance ceremony marking the 20th anniversary the massacre is expected to draw a number of world leaders. Clinton will travel with his former secretary of State, Madeline Albright, as well as members of Congress and diplomatic officials. ADVERTISEMENT In 1995, around 8,000 Muslim men and boys were massacred by Bosnian Serb forces in the town of Srebrenica during the country’s three-and-a-half year war. It was the largest mass killing in Europe since World War II. As president, Clinton helped broker the peace agreement that ended the war. Also accompanying Clinton are Reps. Peter King (R-N.Y.) and Rep. Eliot Engel (D-N.Y.), who supported American efforts to protect Muslims in Bosnia and Kosovo. There is even a street named after Engel in the town of Pec in Kosovo.
